com.percussion.pso.validation
Class PSOValidateRelatedItems

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.extension.PSDefaultExtension
      com.percussion.pso.validation.PSOValidateRelatedItems
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.percussion.extension.IPSExtension, com.percussion.extension.IPSItemValidator, com.percussion.extension.IPSResultDocumentProcessor
public class PSOValidateRelatedItems
extends com.percussion.extension.PSDefaultExtension
implements com.percussion.extension.IPSResultDocumentProcessor, com.percussion.extension.IPSItemValidator

Purpose of this class is to validate the existance of items in a slot. Through an internal resource pointing to a query resource this class retrieves a xml dom doc and locates the slot names occuring therein. It then checks it against the parameters passed to the processResultDocument. Parameters must be passed in the following order:

  1. url to query resource
  2. transitionid against which to validate
  3. variantid of the parent document to validate
  4. slotname of required items
  5. occurance parameters MUST be one of the following: "MORE_THAN" or "LESS_THAN" or "EXACTLY"
  6. number to correspond to parameter 5
Read 3 ,4, 5 and 6 as follows: VARIANTID with SLOT_NAME occurs MORE_THAN 5 To accomodate more validations on the related item simple repeat 3, 4 , 5 and 6 arguments.

In the latest version, the URL and Variant id are not longer needed, as this version uses the Relationship API rather than making an internal request.

Version:
1.1 - added the ability to wild card the transitionid. It will check for a number and act on that transition only or a * and act on all., 2.0 - rewritten to use relationship API instead of making internal requests. The URL and VariantId are no longer used., 2.1 - modified to only fire on workflow requests
Author:
Scott M. Morales

isValid

protected boolean isValid(int slotSize,
                          String mustOccur,
                          int numoftimes)
                   throws com.percussion.extension.PSParameterMismatchException
Check to see if the slotName exists in the map. If it does, makes a quick check against the slotName mustOccur numoftimes values.

Parameters:
slotSize - - the actual size of the slot.
mustOccur - - the mustOccur operation value.
numoftimes - - the number of times value.
Throws:
com.percussion.extension.PSParameterMismatchException - when mustOccur is not MORE_THAN, LESS_THAN or EXACTLY.

processResultDocument

public Document processResultDocument(Object[] params,
                                      com.percussion.server.IPSRequestContext request,
                                      Document resultDoc)
                               throws com.percussion.extension.PSParameterMismatchException,
                                      com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionProcessingException

Required method implemented by interface IPSResultDocumentProcessor This is the method which is called by the rx server. It uses the Object[] params index 0 to get the location of a query resource, then uses the IPSRequestContext to make an internal request to that resource which returns a Document. It then uses that Document and compares it against what has been passed in with the params Object[]. If the comparison returns false this method returns a error page to the user.

The Document must have NODE_TO_CHECK node. Its NODE_TO_CHECK node must have the ATT_TO_CHECK attribute.

It uses the params Object[] to determine the location of the query resource, transitionid on which to act, the slot name to check, how it should check the slot name and for how many items.

EXAMPLE:
Parameters coming in should look like this:

sys_AssemblerInfo/sys_AssemblerInfo
1
312
Behind_Scenes_Index_Slot
MORE_THAN
3
312
Behind_Scenes_Index_Slot
LESS_THAN
9

The first param is the location to the query resource. Not used, included for backwards compatibility.
The second param is the transition id on which to act.(can use * for act on all transitions)
The third and the seventh param is the Variant which holds the slot to be checked. Not used, included for backwards compatibility.
The fourth and the eigth is the Slot Name to check.
The fifth and ninth is how to check that slot.
The sixth and tenth is the number of items.

Specified by:
processResultDocument in interface com.percussion.extension.IPSResultDocumentProcessor
Parameters:
params - Parameters must be passed in the following order: 1 - url to query resource
request -
resultDoc -
Returns:
an XML document - Error page if validation fails, null if not.
Throws:
com.percussion.extension.PSParameterMismatchException
com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionProcessingException

validateParams

private void validateParams(Object[] args)
                     throws com.percussion.extension.PSParameterMismatchException
Validates the parameters passed into the processResultDocument method. The sixth parameter must be either AND or OR inorder to validate additional slots.

Parameters:
args - the params to be validated.
Throws:
com.percussion.extension.PSParameterMismatchException

matchTransitionId

private static boolean matchTransitionId(com.percussion.server.IPSRequestContext request,
                                         String transParameter)
Checks if the current transition matches a specified value. This routine is intended for use in validation exits where a specific transition id is provided as a parameter.

If the parameter supplied is an "*", then this method always returns true. Otherwise, the parameter is compared with the sys_transitionid HTML parameter and then of the WFAction HTML parameter. If either of these values match, then true is returned.

Parameters:
request - the callers request context.
transParameter - the match parameter to be compared. Use "*" to match any transition.
Returns:
true if the transition matches, false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when the transParameter is null.
